revised_title: The Physical Relation of Chloroform to Blood: A Study on Chloroform Absorption and Its Effects
tldr: The author investigates the physical relationship between chloroform and blood, discovering that blood has a greater affinity for chloroform than water. Blood acts as a temporary retaining and restraining medium, helping to convert irregular chloroform flow into a constant one, making it an essential carrier for chloroform in the body.
